page.title: 10Changes in Heywood.1.
page.content: Fourth year pupils at Sutherland High school carried out a street survey to find out what changes people had seen and what they thought of {Heywood } today. People felt there had been a decline in {entertainment }with a lack of dancing and the closure of the town's cinemas. At one time there were 4,now none. Many were worried by the increasing {unemployment }and the decline of the {cotton industry}in which most of them had worked. They would not wish to be leaving school or looking for a job today, even though they thought a wider variety of jobs were being done in the town.Few had a very high opinion of {Heywood }as a place and most of the blame for this was put on the council in {Rochdale } and the take-over of 1974. Many wanted to see {Heywood }run its own affairs again.
